interestingcomments.content:
Improving ceramic access door to sewer /!/ I moved into a new house in June. The finished basement has ceramic (faux wood) floors. The floor features two small sections that are basically access doors: one to the water main, and another to the sewer line. Here’s the one to the sewer:

https://imgur.com/gallery/Q0BodRY

This thing is stuck tight. I cannot lift it up, nor can I pry it open with any of the tools that I have.  

I need:

- to lift this up ASAP to inspect the sewer line. I do not have a ceramic drill bit, but will get one if that’s the only way to open it. 
- to devise a long-term design that will keep this door tightly sealed on a daily basis, but easy to open when I need to. 

I do not have any spare ceramic tiles, but I could probably find this design if I tried. 

Anyone have ideas? TIA!
